docs.abstract: Mr. Hogan, a moderate Republican who is considering a primary challenge to President Trump, called the president’s victory in 2016 an “anomaly.”
docs.snippet: Mr. Hogan, a moderate Republican who is considering a primary challenge to President Trump, called the president’s victory in 2016 an “anomaly.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Gov. Larry Hogan of Maryland, a moderate Republican who is considering a primary challenge to President Trump, said on Saturday that Mr. Trump’s victory in 2016 was an “anomaly” and urged his party to work on appealing to voters outside its “shrinking base.”

headline.main: Larry Hogan, Maryland Governor, Urges Republicans to Look Beyond ‘Shrinking Base’
headline.print_headline: Moderate Urges G.O.P. to Look Beyond Base

byline.original: By Alexander Burns and Lisa Lerer

docs.abstract: Mr. Sanders started the race with the largest donor network in the 2020 field. That list has grown substantially since then, as more than a third of his donations came from new email addresses.
docs.snippet: Mr. Sanders started the race with the largest donor network in the 2020 field. That list has grown substantially since then, as more than a third of his donations came from new email addresses.
docs.lead_paragraph: A clutch of advisers to Senator Bernie Sanders began arriving at the Capitol Hill townhouse that served as his makeshift headquarters before dawn last Tuesday, where they readied themselves to track, among other things, the deluge of donations that would land after Mr. Sanders made his presidential campaign official.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Raises $10 Million in Less Than a Week
headline.print_headline: Early $10 Million Haul For Sanders Suggests Network Is Expanding

docs.abstract: Gov. Gavin Newsom knows that a good relationship with a president he once called on to resign could be crucial to his plans for the state.
docs.snippet: Gov. Gavin Newsom knows that a good relationship with a president he once called on to resign could be crucial to his plans for the state.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

headline.main: California Doesn’t Like Trump. But It May Need Him.

docs.abstract: Throughout his political career, Mr. Sanders has focused on policy, not personal details. But as he kicked off his second presidential bid, he did something new: He talked about his own life story.
docs.snippet: Throughout his political career, Mr. Sanders has focused on policy, not personal details. But as he kicked off his second presidential bid, he did something new: He talked about his own life story.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the words Senator Bernie Sanders used in Brooklyn on Saturday as he kicked off his second run for president were familiar: “revolution,” “economic justice,” “prison-industrial complex.”

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Begins 2020 Race With Some Familiar Themes and a New One: Himself
headline.print_headline: Sanders Begins ’20 Bid With Familiar Refrains And New Story: His Own

docs.abstract: The former secretary of state told a New York television station that she would continue to speak out on issues, saying, “I’m not going anywhere.”
docs.snippet: The former secretary of state told a New York television station that she would continue to speak out on issues, saying, “I’m not going anywhere.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton, the former secretary of state and first lady who lost the White House to Donald J. Trump in 2016, said officially on Monday what has been unofficially clear for months: She is not running for president again in 2020.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Says She Is Not Running for President in 2020
headline.print_headline: Clinton Says She Will Not Be Running Again

docs.abstract: A former governor of Colorado and mayor of Denver, Mr. Hickenlooper is running for president on a more centrist platform than many of his competitors.
docs.snippet: A former governor of Colorado and mayor of Denver, Mr. Hickenlooper is running for president on a more centrist platform than many of his competitors.
docs.lead_paragraph: John Hickenlooper, the former governor of Colorado, faces a basic challenge in the crowded Democratic presidential primary: He is a centrist in a party that’s moving to the left. While he has shifted in some areas, he will still be running to the right of the most prominent candidates, with more of an emphasis on pragmatism than idealism.

docs.abstract: The Georgia Democrat is focusing on voting rights and says she will decide by late March or early April whether to run for president, senator or governor.
docs.snippet: The Georgia Democrat is focusing on voting rights and says she will decide by late March or early April whether to run for president, senator or governor.
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Pick a strategy Democrats are considering ahead of 2020, and Stacey Abrams’s narrow loss in the Georgia governor’s race serves either as a blueprint or a warning sign.

headline.main: Stacey Abrams, After Narrow Loss, Has Some Decisions to Make
headline.print_headline: After Her Narrow Loss, Abrams Takes Stock and Regroups

docs.abstract: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.snippet: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the shutdown’s end to Roger Stone’s indictment, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you’d like to read further).

headline.main: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week

docs.abstract: A spokesman for a conservative group said Mr. Steele, a former chairman of the Republican National Committee, was selected for the role because of his race.
docs.snippet: A spokesman for a conservative group said Mr. Steele, a former chairman of the Republican National Committee, was selected for the role because of his race.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Steele, a former chairman of the Republican National Committee, said on Saturday that the party has a problem with racism after a spokesman for a conservative group said Mr. Steele was chosen as chairman because he is “a black guy.”

headline.main: CPAC Official Says Michael Steele Was Chosen to Lead G.O.P. Because He’s ‘a Black Guy’

docs.abstract: The Trump campaign has helped install allies atop the most significant state parties, and has urged them to discourage conservative criticism of the president.
docs.snippet: The Trump campaign has helped install allies atop the most significant state parties, and has urged them to discourage conservative criticism of the president.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Election Day in 2016, the Republican Party was divided against itself, split over its nominee for president, Donald J. Trump.

headline.main: Trump’s Takeover of the Republican Party Is Almost Complete
headline.print_headline: As 2020 Nears, Trump Tightens Hold on G.O.P.

byline.original: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin
